name: Node.js / JavaScript
description: Rules for Node.js, npm, and JavaScript/TypeScript projects

rules.reason: Environment files contain secrets, API keys, and database credentials that should never be committed
Local environment overrides often contain developer-specific secrets
Environment-specific local files may contain sensitive overrides
Development environment secrets should not be shared
Production secrets must never be committed to version control
Dependencies should be installed via npm/yarn, not committed. This folder can be huge.
Debug logs may contain sensitive information and are not needed in version control
Yarn debug logs may contain sensitive information
Yarn error logs are developer-specific and not needed in version control
npm cache directory should not be committed
Yarn cache is machine-specific and should not be committed
pnpm store is machine-specific
Build output should be generated, not committed. Reduces repo size and merge conflicts.
Build output directory should be regenerated, not committed
Output directory from TypeScript compilation should not be committed
Cache directories are machine-specific
Test coverage reports should be generated locally or in CI, not committed
NYC coverage output is generated and should not be committed
Log files are typically developer or machine-specific
macOS folder metadata file, not relevant to the project
Windows thumbnail cache file, not relevant to the project
TypeScript incremental build info is machine-specific

react.reason: Test environment secrets should not be committed

nextjs.reason: Next.js build output should not be committed
Next.js static export output should be regenerated
Vercel deployment configuration may contain project-specific settings

vue.reason: Nuxt.js build output should not be committed
Nuxt 3 output directory should be regenerated

angular.reason: Angular cache directory should not be committed
Angular build output should be regenerated

vite.reason: Vite build output should be regenerated

svelte.reason: SvelteKit build output should not be committed
Svelte build output should be regenerated
